oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Full plate color tintype of Sgt. Franklin Cummings, Union soldier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cummings served in Co. A, 6th Tenn. Infantry USA and had to go to Boston, KY to enlist after attempted conscription by Confederate authorities. Sgt. Cummings was born April 25, 1824 in Blount County, Tenn. He died of wounds on Dec. 31, 1863 and was buried near Bethlehem Methodist Church. The tintype plate was made by Worcester Plate Works in Worcester, Mass. Its fully painted surface depicts Cummings in uniform holding a pistol in front of camp scene with flag and mortar and ordnance, and earthworks.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cummings, Franklin
